strings: <voice_0x01000C22><se_def>Angelo: Marcello!

<voice_0x01000C23><se_def>Marcello: ...It...was all...that...jester...
I...couldn't...stop him...
<voice_0x01000C24><se_def>Marcello: He's...strong...
<voice_0x01000C25><se_def>Marcello: Urrgh!
<voice_0x01000C26><se_def>Marcello: But you can't...let him...

<voice_0x01000C27><se_def>Marcello: ...This is an order! Templar Angelo!
Get...the Abbot...to safety!

<voice_0x01000C28><se_def>Dhoulmagus: Wha hah hah hah hah!
Now nothing stands in my way!

<voice_0x01000C29><se_def>Marcello: Urgh...!
You dare lay a finger on Abbot Francisco!

<voice_0x01000C2A><se_low>Abbot Francisco: Don't worry, Marcello!
I will be fine.

<voice_0x01000C2B><se_low>Abbot Francisco: I have given myself to the Goddess!
If it is Her wish, I am prepared to die.
<voice_0x01000C2C><se_low>Abbot Francisco: ...But, wretched sinner, if that is not Her wish, nothing you can do will ever harm me!
<voice_0x01000C2D><se_low>Abbot Francisco: The Goddess will protect us all from whatever evil you can muster!

<voice_0x01000C2E><se_def>Dhoulmagus: ...Well, well!
What faith you have!
Let's put it to the test, shall we!?
<voice_0x01000C2F><se_low>King Trode: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait!
<voice_0x01000C30><se_low>Yangus: COR BLIMEY!
<voice_0x01000C31><se_low>King Trode: It's been a while, Dhoulmagus!

<voice_0x01000C32><se_def>Dhoulmagus: Ah! If it isn't King Toad!
Looking as small and ugly as ever!

<voice_0x01000C33><se_low>King Trode: Shut up!
Return my daughter and I to normal at once!
Do you realise what you've done to my castle!?
<voice_0x01000C36><se_low>King Trode: W-What!?
<voice_0x01000C37><se_def>Dhoulmagus: ...Such a pity...
<voice_0x01000C38><se_def>Dhoulmagus: It seems fate and your benevolent Goddess are both on my side...

<voice_0x01000C39><se_def>Dhoulmagus: Hah hah hah!
Yes... Such a pity... Poor Francisco!

<voice_0x01000C3A><se_def>Dhoulmagus: The power!
...Hah hah hah! My work here is done!
<voice_0x01000C3B><se_def>Dhoulmagus: Parting is such sweet sorrow!

<center>The following day,
<center>under a heavy cloud of rain,
<center>Abbot Francisco's body
<center>was committed to the ground.

<center>Meanwhile, Dhoulmagus slipped away
<center>into the darkness once again.

<center>Marcello, who somehow managed to
<center>escape serious injury, explained to everyone
<center>the events of the previous night.

<center><Cap><hero> and the party
<center>were cleared of any suspicion.

<center>Everyone at the funeral felt a terrible sorrow
<center>at the loss of the Abbot, and the heavens, too,
<center>wept tears of grief.

<center>The rain continued until dawn,
<center>the start of a new day...
